[[Monoidal category]]
# Monoidal natural transformation

In order to [[Categorification|categorify]] the notion of [[monoid homomorphism]]
it is necessary to impose data and axioms on both the notion of [[functor]] and of [[natural transformation]] between such functors.
Let $T_{1}, T_{2} : \cat C \to \cat D$ be [[monoidal functor|monoidal functors]] with $(\epsilon_{1},\mu_{1})$ and $(\epsilon_{2},\mu_{2})$ respectively.
A natural transformation $\gamma :T_{1} \Rightarrow T_{2} : \cat C \to \cat D$ is called **monoidal** iff #m/def/cat 

![[monoidal-natural-transformation-1.svg#invert|https://q.uiver.app/#]]

and

![[monoidal-natural-transformation-2.svg#invert|https://q.uiver.app/#q=WzAsMyxbMSwwLCJcXG1hdGhiYiAxIl0sWzAsMSwiVF8xKFxcbWF0aGJiIDEpIl0sWzIsMSwiVF8yKFxcbWF0aGJiIDEpIl0sWzAsMSwiXFxlcHNpbG9uXzEiLDJdLFswLDIsIlxcZXBzaWxvbl8yIl0sWzEsMiwiXFxnYW1tYV97XFxtYXRoYmIgMX0iLDJdXQ==]]

commute for all objects $x, y \in \cat C$.
